page.title: 08Overton Farm, Sway.
page.content: Twenty years ago there were 9 dairy farms in the Sway area. The{Guernsey {herd}at Overton is now the only one left. The 130 acres of land on the farm are given over to grass which is used for grazing and producing enough silage and hay to feed the herd during the winter. Between October and April when the cows are kept undercover each cow consumes 6 tons of silage, 100 bales of hay and uses 120 bales of straw for bedding. High protein dairy nut consumption during the year works out at 1.5 tons per animal. E.E.C. quotas on milk production penalise farmers who produce a surplus and a few pigs are kept at Overton which are fed on any excess milk which might be produced.
